$UVIX respectfully disagree. Pay to play. Certain times call for more risk. I believe we are living through one of those times. Best to not get too much total exposure to this at any one time, but these instruments are used by many who are rewarded — myself included — as hedges for periods longer than a day trade. The big risk of doing this can lead to big reward and a lot of peace of mind if you are staying long in your other investments while keeping a position in this. I certainly wouldn’t add again until I see 9’s and that would have to be sooner than later, since yes decay is a thing to be mindful of. But that’s also because I was already adding in the 9’s / low 10’s like a mad man. Best of luck to all in these wild times! $SPY $SOXX $SOXS $VIX

@wireless_cowboy was testing against WeBull at the same time. Wanted the real world test. I know paper fills can be just a snapshot of the bid/ask. On $RANI  this morning, clicking at the same time, I got filled .03 cents cheaper on IBKR during a spike. Was for only a few shares but that’s what I wanted to see. At my usual non margin buying power I play with that’s $150 of otherwise missed gains.

I do like to use WeBull paper as a watchlist that tracks price though when I’m not confident enough to buy something. Definitely cleaned up a lot of my bad habits and FOMO through various paper accounts.

@junior2305 @MMaker1 

Junior. There’s my 2027 date I’ve called for. 

Koolaid drinkers until mid 2026. 

2027 arrives and people simply say, WTF has happened. 

Let’s say my timelines are wrong. 

I personally don’t care, at some point, I’m going to be protecting my capital. 

While I’m currently rebalancing my portfolio, at some point next year I will start hedging. 

The hedge will be shorting certain tickers. 

There’s also a possibility that I sell the majority of my positions and simply sit on the sidelines like Buffett? Simply pay the capital gains and be content. 
I’m up 200+% this year. 

He’s been sitting on a huge cash position for years now. It’s lasting longer than he thought it would, but we’re getting closer. 

He will be able to buy any company he wants when The Big Ugly occurs. 
Hell, he could buy 2-5 companies.

@FeedMillManager @FractionalShareWhale @RichardFordemteets @johnkicklighter  Really?  That bar graph ONLY shows the debt accumulation under each administration (do the research for yourself regarding that so called "fantasy").  And yes, what party controls the House/Senate influences Congressional spend and the passage of legislation.  But re-focusing and going back to my original siloed comment - a short dated debt issued 2024 problem- coming home to roost and the challenges of dealing with that - regardless of who was going to be in office.  Good luck out there everyone!

@FractionalShareWhale @FeedMillManager @RichardFordemteets @johnkicklighter The Treasury Department is solely responsible for issuing debt—bills, notes, and bonds—via auctions. The Fed does not issue debt. Janet Yellen and her team decided on the maturity mix (e.g., short-term vs long-term), auction schedule, and volume based on funding needs and market conditions. In 2024, Treasury dramatically increased short-term issuance, especially Treasury Bills (T-Bills).  The short term issuance increased rollover risk and front-loaded interest rate exposure which blunted the Fed’s tightening efforts  because short-term debt issuance lowered long-term yields—similar to a stealth rate cut. But the Fed’s actions (or constraints) shaped how that debt was absorbed and priced.  And yes, a President can indirectly influence QE via other means and narrative pressures in which decisions are made.  But to be clear, this is not a one side vs the other regarding increasing and cumulative U.S debt.

@Wiley3300k that is interesting. Neither of the two is such a star company, however CRWV has opted for a strategy (many disagree with including myself) to spend first and earn later. They have tremendous support from hyperscalers and NVDA. Barring external geopolitical / economic factors, CRWV will fix the situation by increasing revenues and postponing debt repayment. CORZ has none of these characteristics, its weakest spot is that it is still a hybrid bitcoin mining / hosting company, and it too has a heavy debt that is several times larger than revenues. (and revenues decreased in 2025!) I am not an analyst! It is just my opinion. I do not own any security of any bitcoin miners, I don't see the point in that. And I don't work at CRWV lol, I wish haha. Have a great weekend! :-)  PS: I don't own any stock of CRWV, options only, hence not only I don't work there but I don't vote either see?  It's just my opinion

@TOTrader2025 @WhyAlwaysMe_ I love your analogy lol. It seems to me that the markets have become so incredibly important to him, far more than in his previous term.
But it may be more sinister than that, because the market is what’s keeping the economy from going into a recession. If the stock market collapses, that’s basically your initial trigger for the recession (and then you have the generational buying opportunity).

Anyway, the moment the premarket opened, I slid in a tiny $UVIX -> $SVIX exchange to continue my DCA on SVIX.  And some small nibbles on ETHU BITU.

Options expiration today… Though I think most of the real activity happened yesterday, so today should be a lot calmer.

But I would have sold at least half of my UVIX position between $16-$17 if I was given the opportunity which of course was frustrating that it all happened out of reach.

I don’t believe that that was the end of this selling, not at $SPY658, that’s for sure.  But will have to wait till next week.
